items.summary: Roblox has been called to an urgent meeting with the federal government in the wake of reports that children are being groomed by predators and exposed to sexually explicit material on the popular online gaming platform.

items.title: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark was jailed but his community says legal issues persist
items.summary: Former ATSIC leader Geoff Clark was jailed in 2024, yet some members of his community say legal issues linger on.

items.title: More people say they'll vote One Nation. What are they voting for?
items.summary: One Nation questions if man-made climate change is real, wants to wind back access to abortion care and plans to pay the HECS debts of doctors working in the regions.

items.title: Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka and the art of cutting through political spin
items.summary: Hailed as an artist who "knew the power of comedy in holding truth to power", Jon Kudelka once described himself as "like a monkey with an automatic rifle".

items.title: Jon Kudelka, Walkley-winning Tasmanian cartoonist, dies from brain cancer
items.summary: Award-winning Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka dies after being diagnosed with brain cancer in 2024.

items.title: Court appoints statutory trustee to sell rundown Rockhampton Plaza Hotel
items.summary: After years of complaints from local authorities, a judge has ordered the sale of the property which sits surrounded by temporary fencing, with smashed windows and timber boards nailed across its seven-storey façade.

items.title: Equine photography in demand in Australian performance horse industry
items.summary: From leaf blowers to dance moves, photographers use every trick they can think of to get the perfect shot for the biggest performance-horse sale in the southern hemisphere.

items.title: 3 Doors Down frontman Brad Arnold dies after stage four cancer battle
items.summary: Brad Arnold, a founder and the lead singer of American rock band 3 Doors Down, dies nine months after revealing he had kidney cancer.

items.title: New Hobart zip-line proposal for public land, but this one wouldn't be on Kunanyi/Mount Wellington
items.summary: Another zip-line is being proposed for public land near Hobart, almost a year after the last proposal on Kunanyi/Mt Wellington was knocked back by the Hobart City Council.

items.title: Why 13yo Austin Appelbee's story of survival resonated so strongly across the globe
items.summary: The remarkable story of Austin Appelbee's marathon swim for help went around the world, so why did it spark such an emotional reaction?

items.title: Adelaide Festival leader Julian Hobba reflects on Writers' Week controversy
items.summary: As Adelaide Writers' Week went up in flames, Julian Hobba contemplated resigning as Adelaide Festival's executive director. He now says "we needed to trust the judgement" of the literary event's former leader, Louise Adler.

items.title: Sarah Snook, The Newsreader and Bring Her Back triumph at AACTA Awards — as it happened
items.summary: Australia's answer to the Oscars — the AACTAs — lit up the Gold Coast tonight, with horror Bring Her Back and The Narrow Road to the Deep North dominating.

items.title: Two young sisters die in hospital days after fire ripped through their Townsville home
items.summary: Two children die in hospital after a fire ripped through a Queensland home earlier this week.

items.title: ATO debt continues to drive record level of calls to small business financial helpline
items.summary: Financial counsellors say small businesses struggling to pay debts owed to the tax office are driving calls to Australia's Small Business Debt Helpline higher.

items.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia
items.summary: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

items.title: US hopes to challenge China's critical minerals dominance with new trading bloc
items.summary: The US is urging dozens of countries to follow Australia's lead and sign on to a plan to stop relying on China for the critical minerals used in modern technology.

items.title: Satellite images reveal build-up of US fighter jets and missile defences ahead of US-Iran nuclear talks
items.summary: Ahead of planned nuclear talks between the United States and Iran, satellite imagery reveals how the US is positioning itself for potential military escalation.

items.title: Diamonds defeat Jamaica in first netball Test match in Adelaide
items.summary: The Diamonds made a flying start with the initial six goals in a comprehensive 72-41 victory at the Adelaide Entertainment Centre.

items.title: Invasion Day bomb declared terror act, as accused's 'pro-white ideology' probed
items.summary: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

items.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
items.summary: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

items.title: Palliative care specialists see living wakes growing in popularity
items.summary: There is growing interest in living wakes, which allow people whose time is short to farewell their loved ones.

items.title: How decluttering your digital streaming subscriptions can save you money this year
items.summary: With Australian households now holding an average of 3.7 digital entertainment subscriptions each, doing an audit on what you're using and whether it's providing value can be a good place to start when looking to cut costs.

items.title: Brisbane baby coffee assault tests Australia-China relations
items.summary: Sixteen months after a stranger poured scalding coffee over a baby in a Brisbane park, China's decision to send a working group to Australia marks the first tangible shift in a complicated case.

items.title: Youth homelessness leaves 'huge hidden population' seeking safety at school
items.summary: A coalition calls for action to help the "huge hidden population" of young people in Western Australia who are experiencing homelessness, with children left feeling ashamed and alone even in the safety of school.

items.title: Novak Djokovic praises Carlos Alcaraz after Spaniard wins first Australian Open title
items.summary: Despite the hollow feeling of defeat, 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic heaps praise on Carlos Alcaraz following the Spaniard's history-making Australian Open victory.

items.title: Novak Djokovic drops retirement hint, suggests 2026 could be his final Australian Open
items.summary: Novak Djokovic did not go into detail on what he meant, nor did he confirm a plan to retire this year, but he chose his words carefully on centre court.

items.title: Lily Allen has made a huge comeback — soon she'll be in Australia
items.summary: The British singer made her triumphant return to the annual countdown with two tracks from her latest album West End Girl.

items.title: Children in stable condition after Townsville house fire left them fighting for life
items.summary: Two children are now stable but still in a critical condition after being pulled to rescue through the roof of a home on fire in north Queensland early this morning.

items.title: Leon Ford and Celia Pacquola show why it's always the reluctant dads who need pets most in Dog Park
items.summary: In the new cathartic drama/comedy starring Leon Ford and Celia Pacquola, dogs are the answer to everything.

items.title: Prime minister and SA premier announce $800 million deal for 17,000 new homes
items.summary: Funding for water infrastructure, urban renewal projects and first-home buyer schemes has been announced in a partnership between the Commonwealth and the state government.

items.title: Catherine O'Hara from Home Alone and Schitt's Creek dies aged 71
items.summary: The Canadian-born actress died at her home in Los Angeles at the age of 71 "following a brief illness", according to a statement from her agency.

items.title: Bluey tops streaming charts in US for second year running
items.summary: Americans tuned in to watch 45.2 billion minutes of Bluey, Bingo, Bandit and Chilli last year.

items.title: Parramatta provided with emails from Zac Lomax's lawyer as contract drama plays out in court
items.summary: Parramatta has been given nine emails sent by Zac Lomax's lawyer as the case between the former Eels winger and his former club prepares to hit the courtroom.

items.title: Health courses the most popular area of study for Australian university students in 2026, as IT enrolments fall
items.summary: Data from the country's tertiary admissions centres shows health courses are again the most popular area of study for university students in 2026.

items.title: Noosa houseboats forced off river as new maritime rules take effect
items.summary: A David and Goliath battle is playing out on the multi-million-dollar shores of the Noosa River, where dozens of houseboat residents say they are being forced out and potentially into financial ruin.

items.title: Woman discovers Holocaust descendants through DNA testing
items.summary: Adriana Turk grew up believing there were no survivors on her Jewish father's side after World War II, but a DNA test showed that was not the case.

items.title: Two men dead after drowning in Never Never River north of Bellingen
items.summary: Two men have drowned and another remains in a stable condition in hospital after a mishap in a river on the New South Wales Mid North Coast.

items.title: Fire destroys Portsea home on the Mornington Peninsula, south of Melbourne
items.summary: The blaze in the large Mornington Peninsula home took dozens of firefighters more than two hours to bring under control.

items.title: FBI arrests ex-Olympian Ryan Wedding, likens him to drug kingpin Pablo Escobar
items.summary: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding has been charged with drug trafficking, multiple murders, and has been linked to Mexico's Sinaloa Cartel.

items.title: How to attract native wildlife and birds to your garden
items.summary: There are simple things we can all do to encourage more native wildlife to our gardens, backyards, balconies and shared spaces.

items.title: Albanese apologies for Bondi Beach terror deaths
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Iranian official says verified deaths in Iran protests reach at least 5,000
items.summary: The death toll includes about 500 security personnel and exceeds that of any other round of protest or unrest in Iran in decades.

items.title: WA is losing the tobacco wars as gangs target vape stores and cheap cigarettes flood market
items.summary: Burnt out storefronts in Perth and regional cities are testament to the government's inability to control the illegal tobacco trade — and it's not clear when things will change, writes Keane Bourke.

items.title: Shooters 'anxious' as ACT government looks to reform 'outdated' gun laws
items.summary: Professional and recreational shooters say they want to see extensive community consultation before any changes are made to the ACT's gun laws.

items.title: Four arrested as Queensland Police seize guns, kilos of drugs in Townsville
items.summary: Police find 100kg cannabis, 8kg of methamphetamine and 1kg of cocaine as well as illegal firearms hidden in bush at a Townsville property.

items.title: Plans for Kununurra Aboriginal short stay accommodation abandoned despite dire need
items.summary: Leaders in Kununurra say the Cook Government's decision to dump plans for Aboriginal short stay accommodation in town could be putting more people at risk.

items.title: Hong Kong fire at Wang Fuk Court killed 168 people, local authorities announce
items.summary: The final death toll is seven higher than previously reported and comes months after the fire tore through the apartment complex.

items.title: Golden Globes 2026 winners list: Owen Cooper, Stephen Graham win for Adolescence performances
items.summary: Here is the full winners list from the Golden Globes, where Adolescence sweeps all categories and the Pitt wins best drama series.

items.title: The tough balance of circumstance and support systems as WA woman faces eviction
items.summary: As protesters strive to keep a woman from community housing eviction, the complexities of her situation collide with a housing provider's options.

items.title: Dragons sign Keaon Koloamatangi from Rabbitohs on massive five-year NRL deal
items.summary: Dragons supporters will have to wait until 2027 to see Keaon Koloamatangi wearing the Red V, but the club describes his signing as the "biggest" in their recent history.

items.title: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro held in New York prison described as 'hell on earth'
items.summary: The facility where detained Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has been taken is a notorious New York jail that has held a string of high-profile and celebrity criminals, from drug cartel leaders to hip-hop stars.

items.title: AI technology gives swimming pool lifeguards an extra set of eyes this summer
items.summary: An AI system used in 120 public pools across Australia analyses swimmers' movements and sends an alert to a lifeguard's smartwatch if it detects someone in trouble.

items.title: Girl, 12, critical after being pulled from water at Trigg Beach in Perth's north
items.summary: A 12-year-old girl is in a critical condition after a surfer pulled her unresponsive from the water at Trigg Beach on Tuesday.

items.title: Best podcasts of 2025, from Forged to Fela Kuti: Fear No Man
items.summary: Our favourite podcasts of the year include tales of art forgery, a documentary about the life of Fela Kútì and a true-crime thriller about a dead body in the ocean.

items.title: In pictures: Surf lifesavers pay tribute to Bondi victims
items.summary: Hundreds of surf lifesavers and lifeguards, many of whom responded to the Bondi terror attack, form a human chain in a moving tribute to the 15 people killed.

items.title: Local organiser calls on Albanese to attend every Bondi funeral
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Call for action on homelessness as WA government falls short of target to end rough sleeping
items.summary: Social services want the WA government to use its significant budget surplus to invest in breaking people out of the cycle of homelessness, after it failed to achieve its goal of ending rough sleeping.

items.title: Diverse university entry in the spotlight as NSW year 12 students await ATAR results
items.summary: A south-west Sydney graduate who received disappointing final exam results is now pursuing a career in social work, encouraging high school students to avoid pinning their future goals to their grades.

items.title: Farmers' Facebook group racks up 100,000 followers as they seek support across seasons
items.summary: A group dedicated to Australian grain farming created more than a decade ago has just cracked 100,000 followers with about 20,000 people following from overseas.

items.title: Bondi terrorists travelled to Philippines for 'military-style training', security sources say
items.summary: Father-son gunmen Sajid and Naveed Akram travelled to the Philippines to receive "military-style training" in the month before they killed 15 people at a Hanukkah celebration at Bondi Beach, security sources have confirmed.

items.title: Researchers call for water safety to be part of English education for migrants
items.summary: As the country heads into the summer holidays, experts are again warning Australians to be aware of swim safety at beaches, pools and other waterways.

items.title: Iron deficiency is a challenge for many female athletes, like Super Netball's Zara Walters
items.summary: Zara Walters felt tired, dizzy and unable to recover from training sessions — then she found out she was low in iron. It's a condition that often goes undiagnosed, especially in female athletes.

items.title: Hollywood director Carl Rinsch convicted of scamming Netflix out of $16.5m
items.summary: Carl Erik Rinsch is convicted on charges that he scammed Netflix out of $US11 million for a show that never materialised, instead using the cash for purchases including luxury cars and homewares.

items.title: Why the football Dylan Brown showed for New Zealand can make his record-breaking move to Newcastle pay off
items.summary: The football Dylan Brown played for New Zealand should have won him the Golden Boot but it could also be the key to his record-breaking move to Newcastle.

items.title: Queensland family living in a tent in Bundaberg say they're not considered homeless
items.summary: Simone Owen is living in a tent with her husband and two children, but she says they are not considered homeless so do not qualify for crisis accommodation.

items.title: Australian man Lamar Ahchee accused of smuggling cocaine in Bali tells court he was 'coerced'
items.summary: Lamar Ahchee was arrested in Bali in May after Indonesian police tracked the delivery of two packages containing cocaine to his apartment.

items.title: Mackay riverfront under the microscope as community grapples with addiction and homelessness
items.summary: The banks of the Pioneer River near Mackay's CBD are home to makeshift camps nestled among the trees, while others reside in picnic shelters by the wharves.
